intro: Azalea × marginata, commonly known as the Japanese azalea, is a hybrid shrub native to East Asia. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing fragrant, bell-shaped petals. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to produce multiple flower clusters along its stems.
